country.germany.metaTitle: Top Doctors in Germany | Department Heads & Leading Specialists | CareOverseas
country.germany.metaDesc: Explore Germany’s leading doctors and department heads at HELIOS, Charité, LMU, TUM, Cologne and more. Filter by specialty, clinic, and city. Independent directory with coordinator support.
country.germany.title: Germany — Doctors Directory
country.germany.subtitle: Independent, information-only directory of department heads and unit leaders at HELIOS, Charité, University Hospital Cologne, and other top centers.
country.germany.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, specialty, or clinic
country.germany.sort.name: Name
country.germany.empty: No matches. Try changing filters or query.
country.germany.usp.expertsDesc: We shortlist department heads and leaders of specialized units only.
country.germany.usp.safeDesc: Clear coordination, documents in your language, and no marketing contracts.
country.germany.usp.careDesc: Personal guidance from first contact to your return home.
country.germany.emptyHint: Try another city, clinic, or specialty.
country.germany.pitch.title: Not sure which doctor is right for you?
country.germany.pitch.subtitle: Tell us the diagnosis and preferences. We’ll match you with the right department head, prepare the request, and help you get a fast reply from the clinic.

people.doctors.charite-comprehensive-can: Professor of Oncology and Director of Charité Comprehensive Cancer Center

Prof. Dr. Ulrich Keilholz is an internationally recognized oncologist and Director of the Charité Comprehensive Cancer Center in Berlin. He is a leading expert in immunotherapy, targeted therapies, and personalized cancer treatment strategies, with groundbreaking research in melanoma and solid tumors.
people.doctors.charite-universitatsmediz: Professor of Psychiatry and Psychotherapy

Prof. Dr. Christian Otte is a renowned psychiatrist at Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin, specializing in depression, stress-related disorders, and clinical psychopharmacology. His research focuses on developing innovative therapies for affective disorders and improving outcomes through translational psychiatry.
Professor of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery

Prof. Dr. Max Heiland is Head of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at Charité Berlin. He is a specialist in oncological reconstructive surgery, craniofacial surgery, and implantology, recognized for advancing microsurgical techniques and complex tumor reconstructions.
Professor of Trauma and Orthopedic Surgery

Prof. Dr. Wolfgang Ertel is a leading trauma surgeon at Charité Berlin, specializing in polytrauma management, septic surgery, and musculoskeletal injuries. He has extensive expertise in critical emergency care and innovative treatment of complex fractures and infections.
Professor of Radiation Oncology

Prof. Dr. Daniel Zips is a distinguished radiation oncologist at Charité Berlin, focusing on precision radiotherapy, head and neck cancers, and combined multimodal therapies. His clinical work integrates cutting-edge radiotherapy with systemic treatments to improve survival outcomes.
Professor of Pulmonology and Infectious Diseases

Prof. Dr. Martin Witzenrath is an expert in pulmonology and infectious diseases at Charité Berlin. His main areas of expertise include pneumonia, sepsis, and innovative anti-infective therapies, with internationally recognized contributions in respiratory medicine research.
Professor of Gastroenterology and Director of Medical Department, Division of Gastroenterology

Prof. Dr. Britta Siegmund is a leading gastroenterologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) including Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. She is internationally known for her translational research bridging immunology and clinical gastroenterology.
Professor of Hepatology and Gastroenterology

Prof. Dr. Frank Tacke is a hepatologist and gastroenterologist at Charité Berlin with expertise in liver cirrhosis, hepatocellular carcinoma, and liver immunology. He is recognized for his pioneering work in understanding liver inflammation and regenerative medicine.
Professor of Nephrology

Prof. Dr. Kai-Uwe Eckardt is one of Europe’s foremost nephrologists, leading the Department of Nephrology at Charité Berlin. His expertise includes chronic kidney disease, dialysis, and kidney transplantation, with a strong focus on advancing renal replacement therapies.
Professor of Hematology and Oncology

Prof. Dr. Ulrich Keller is a hematologist and oncologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in leukemia, lymphoma, and innovative molecular-targeted cancer therapies. He is known for translational research in hematological malignancies and personalized treatment strategies.
Professor of Neurology

Prof. Dr. Matthias Endres is a world-leading neurologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in stroke medicine, neuroprotection, and neuroregeneration. He has contributed significantly to developing therapies for cerebrovascular diseases and improving stroke care worldwide.
Professor of Neurosurgery and Director of the Neurosurgical Clinic

Prof. Dr. Peter Vajkoczy is one of Europe’s top neurosurgeons and Director of Neurosurgery at Charité Berlin. He is an authority in brain tumor surgery, cerebrovascular neurosurgery, and spinal surgery, renowned for innovative minimally invasive and complex surgical techniques.
Professor of Ophthalmology

Prof. Dr. Antonia Joussen is a distinguished ophthalmologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in retinal diseases, ocular oncology, and innovative surgical techniques. Her research in diabetic retinopathy and macular degeneration has international recognition.
Professor of Otorhinolaryngology (ENT)

Prof. Dr. Heidi Olze is an ENT specialist at Charité Berlin with expertise in cochlear implants, hearing rehabilitation, and surgical treatment of hearing loss. She is internationally known for advancing auditory implant research and restoring hearing in complex cases.
Professor of Vascular Surgery

Prof. Dr. Andreas Greiner is a vascular surgeon at Charité Berlin, focusing on arterial reconstruction, aneurysm treatment, and endovascular surgery. He is known for developing minimally invasive vascular techniques and optimizing outcomes in complex vascular cases.
Professor of Surgery and Transplantation

Prof. Dr. Johann Pratschke is Head of the Department of Surgery at Charité Berlin, specializing in organ transplantation, hepatobiliary surgery, and complex abdominal surgery. He is one of Germany’s leading experts in liver and kidney transplantation.
Professor of Urology

Prof. Dr. Thorsten Schlomm is a leading urologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in prostate cancer, minimally invasive urologic surgery, and precision oncology. He is internationally recognized for his contributions to robotic-assisted surgery and individualized cancer therapy.
Professor of Orthopedic Surgery

Prof. Dr. Carsten Perka is an orthopedic surgeon at Charité Berlin with expertise in joint replacement, revision arthroplasty, and musculoskeletal reconstruction. He is a pioneer in complex hip and knee surgeries, combining innovative implants with advanced surgical techniques.
Professor of Oncology

Prof. Dr. Sebastian Stintzing is a medical oncologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in gastrointestinal cancers, targeted therapies, and translational oncology. He is known for clinical trials advancing personalized cancer therapies in colorectal cancer.
Professor of Gynecology and Obstetrics

Prof. Dr. Jens-Uwe Blohmer is a gynecologist at Charité Berlin with expertise in breast cancer, oncoplastic surgery, and individualized therapy concepts. He is widely recognized for his research in optimizing surgical and systemic treatment of breast malignancies.
Professor of Hematology and Oncology

Prof. Dr. Lars Bullinger is a hematologist and oncologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in leukemia, lymphoma, and molecular precision medicine. He is internationally known for advancing genomic approaches in the diagnosis and treatment of hematologic cancers.
Professor of Gynecology and Director of the Department of Gynecology

Prof. Dr. Jalid Sehouli is a leading gynecologic oncologist at Charité Berlin, specializing in ovarian cancer, peritoneal carcinomatosis, and surgical oncology. He is recognized for his pioneering work in complex cytoreductive surgery and international leadership in gynecologic cancer research.
Professor of Psychiatry and Psychotherapy

Prof. Dr. Malek Bajbouj is a psychiatrist at Charité Berlin with expertise in depression, anxiety disorders, and neurostimulation therapies. He is a recognized expert in transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) and other innovative treatments for resistant depression.
people.doctors.ethianum-klinik-heidelber: Prof. Dr. Christoph Michalski is a leading surgical oncologist at ETHIANUM Klinik Heidelberg, specializing in pancreatic, gastrointestinal, and hepatobiliary cancers. He is internationally recognized for advanced surgical techniques in pancreatic cancer and multidisciplinary cancer care.
Professor of Trauma and Reconstructive Surgery

Prof. Dr. Gerhard Schmidmaier is an expert in trauma and reconstructive surgery at ETHIANUM Heidelberg, with a focus on complex fractures, bone regeneration, and innovative biomaterials. He is renowned for pioneering work in orthopedic trauma care and tissue engineering.
Professor of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine

Prof. Dr. Markus A. Weigand is Head of Anesthesiology at ETHIANUM Klinik Heidelberg. He specializes in perioperative medicine, intensive care, and pain management, with internationally recognized research in organ protection and patient safety during surgery.

Prof. Dr. Patrick Schuler is a distinguished ENT surgeon at ETHIANUM Heidelberg, specializing in head and neck oncology, reconstructive microsurgery, and minimally invasive ENT procedures. He is known for advancing surgical care in complex head and neck cancers.

Prof. Dr. Sandro Krieg is a neurosurgeon at ETHIANUM Heidelberg, specializing in brain tumor surgery, intraoperative neuromonitoring, and functional neurosurgery. He is internationally recognized for innovations in preserving neurological function during complex neurosurgical procedures.

Prof. Dr. Wolfgang Wick is an internationally acclaimed neurologist and neuro-oncologist at ETHIANUM Heidelberg. He specializes in brain tumors, multiple sclerosis, and clinical neuro-oncology, with pioneering research in glioblastoma treatment and immunotherapy.
people.doctors.helios-amper-klinikum-dac: Specialist in Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine

Dr. Wolfgang Koedel is a rehabilitation medicine specialist at HELIOS Amper Klinikum Dachau, focusing on restoring mobility and function after neurological and orthopedic conditions. His expertise includes neurorehabilitation and individualized therapy concepts.

PD Dr. Bernhard Witzenbichler is a cardiologist at HELIOS Amper Klinikum Dachau, specializing in interventional cardiology, coronary artery disease, and heart failure. He is recognized for expertise in cardiac catheterization and advanced cardiovascular therapies.
Professor of General and Visceral Surgery

Prof. Dr. Axel Kleespies is a general and visceral surgeon at HELIOS Amper Klinikum Dachau, with expertise in gastrointestinal surgery, oncologic surgery, and minimally invasive techniques. He is particularly experienced in treating complex abdominal cancers.

Prof. Dr. Holger Poppert is a neurologist at HELIOS Amper Klinikum Dachau, specializing in stroke medicine, cerebrovascular disorders, and neurocritical care. He is known for innovative approaches in acute stroke treatment and prevention.

Prof. Dr. Norbert Grüner is a gastroenterologist at HELIOS Amper Klinikum Dachau, specializing in liver diseases, gastrointestinal oncology, and endoscopic diagnostics. His expertise includes advanced therapies for chronic inflammatory bowel disease.
Dr. Ryang is a neurosurgeon at HELIOS Berlin-Buch, specializing in spinal surgery, brain tumors, and complex neurosurgical procedures. He is recognized for minimally invasive techniques and patient-centered neurosurgical care.
people.doctors.helios-berlin-buch-schrad: Dr. Schrader is a urologist at HELIOS Berlin-Buch, specializing in prostate cancer, kidney and bladder diseases, and minimally invasive urologic surgery. His expertise includes robotic-assisted procedures and personalized treatment concepts.
people.doctors.helios-frankenwald-klinik: Dr. Hamadneh is a gastroenterologist at HELIOS Frankenwald Klinik Kronach, focusing on digestive system diseases, endoscopy, and gastrointestinal oncology. He has extensive expertise in the diagnosis and treatment of chronic digestive conditions.

Dr. Michael Moritz is a vascular surgeon at HELIOS Frankenwald Klinik Kronach, specializing in arterial and venous surgery, aneurysm repair, and endovascular procedures. He is known for advanced surgical treatment of peripheral vascular diseases.

Dr. Milos Popovic is a gynecologist at HELIOS Frankenwald Klinik Kronach, focusing on obstetrics, gynecological oncology, and minimally invasive surgery. He is experienced in providing comprehensive care for women’s reproductive health.

Dr. Gennaro Manzo is an orthopedic specialist at HELIOS Frankenwald Klinik Kronach, with expertise in joint replacement, trauma orthopedics, and sports injuries. He is recognized for advanced surgical techniques in hip and knee reconstruction.

Dr. Smajl Marmullaku is a geriatric medicine specialist at HELIOS Frankenwald Klinik Kronach, focusing on age-related diseases, multimorbidity, and comprehensive elderly patient care. He is dedicated to improving quality of life in geriatric patients.
people.doctors.helios-klinik-breisach-dr: Dr. Claus-Henning Lüppchen is a urologist at HELIOS Klinik Breisach, specializing in prostate health, kidney stones, and urinary tract diseases. He is skilled in minimally invasive and endoscopic urologic procedures.

Dr. Martin Schuster is an internist at HELIOS Klinik Breisach, focusing on cardiology, metabolic disorders, and preventive medicine. He provides comprehensive diagnostic and therapeutic care for a wide range of internal diseases.

Dr. Stefan Kleinert is an orthopedic surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Breisach, specializing in joint replacement, trauma orthopedics, and sports medicine. He has significant expertise in hip and knee reconstruction.
people.doctors.helios-klinik-breisach-pr: Prof. Dr. Stefan M. Knöller is a spinal surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Breisach, specializing in spinal deformities, minimally invasive spine surgery, and disc replacement. He is renowned for innovative surgical solutions in complex spinal cases.
people.doctors.helios-klinik-rottweil-dr: Dr. Cosmin Curelariu is a geriatrician at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, specializing in age-related diseases, dementia care, and multidisciplinary management of elderly patients. He is committed to improving mobility and independence in older adults.

Dr. Kai Mehlhase is a vascular surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, specializing in endovascular procedures, varicose vein treatment, and complex arterial reconstruction. He is recognized for modern minimally invasive vascular surgery techniques.

Dr. Markus Zenz is a gynecologist at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, focusing on reproductive health, obstetrics, and gynecological oncology. He has expertise in minimally invasive gynecological surgery and comprehensive women’s care.
Specialist in General and Visceral Surgery

Dr. René Hodina is a general and visceral surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, specializing in abdominal surgery, gastrointestinal oncology, and minimally invasive surgical techniques. He has extensive experience in complex digestive tract operations.

Dr. Sandra Brandauer is an anesthesiologist at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, specializing in perioperative care, pain management, and intensive care medicine. She is dedicated to patient safety and advanced anesthesia techniques.
people.doctors.helios-klinik-rottweil-pr: Prof. Dr. Markus Körber is an orthopedic surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Rottweil, specializing in spinal orthopedics, joint replacement, and musculoskeletal reconstruction. He is recognized for pioneering surgical solutions in complex orthopedic cases.
people.doctors.helios-klinik-titisee-neu: Dr. Claudia Fritz is a gynecologist at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, specializing in obstetrics, gynecological oncology, and preventive care. She is experienced in minimally invasive gynecological surgery and personalized women’s health care.
Specialist in Internal Medicine and Intensive Care

Dr. Constanze Vollmer is an internal medicine and intensive care specialist at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt. She focuses on critical care, respiratory medicine, and managing complex internal diseases requiring intensive treatment.

Dr. Jan Jürgens is a gynecologist at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, with expertise in reproductive health, high-risk pregnancy, and gynecological oncology. He provides comprehensive care across the spectrum of women’s health.

Dr. Lorand Alin Stoica is an orthopedic surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, specializing in trauma orthopedics, joint reconstruction, and sports injuries. He is experienced in minimally invasive orthopedic surgery and rehabilitation-oriented care.

Dr. Manfred Schmölders is a geriatric specialist at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, focusing on multimorbidity, dementia, and holistic care of elderly patients. His approach integrates preventive geriatrics with modern therapeutic strategies.

Dr. Thomas Mrotzek is an anesthesiologist at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, specializing in anesthesia for high-risk patients, intensive care, and pain management. He ensures safe perioperative care with advanced monitoring techniques.
Professor of General and Visceral Surgery

Prof. Dr. Benjamin Sommer is a general and visceral surgeon at HELIOS Klinik Titisee-Neustadt, specializing in complex abdominal surgery, colorectal cancer, and minimally invasive techniques. He is known for expertise in oncologic and reconstructive digestive surgery.
people.doctors.helios-klinikum-bad-saaro: Chief Physician of Trauma & Orthopedic Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

Dr. Jens Osel, LL.M., is Medical Director and Head of Trauma & Orthopedics at HELIOS Bad Saarow. Top focus: complex foot and ankle surgery, special orthopedic and trauma surgery, rheumatology care, and regional trauma center leadership. Recognized by FOCUS for foot surgery and experienced in UK treatment centers.
Chief Physician of Anesthesiology, Intensive Care & Perioperative Pain | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

Dr. Stefan Wirtz leads anesthesia, ICU and perioperative pain therapy with advanced sepsis, ARDS/ECMO and weaning programs. Strengths: perioperative safety, critical care ultrasound/TEE, and palliative expertise for complex surgical patients.
Chief Physician of Vascular & Endovascular Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

Dr. Walid Ibrahim heads the Vascular and Aortic Center, specializing in minimally invasive aortic/AAA repair, hybrid-OR endovascular therapy and comprehensive vascular medicine pathways across angiology–radiology–surgery.
Chief Physician of Cardiology | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

PD Dr. Erdal Şafak is an interventional cardiologist with elite expertise in electrophysiology, device therapy (ICD/CRT), structural heart interventions (PFO/MitraClip), and intensive cardiac care. Unique mix of rhythmology and interventional cardiology.
Chief Physician of Neurology | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

PD Dr. Konstantin Prass, MBA, leads acute neurology and neuro-ICU with 24/7 thrombectomy network. Strengths: stroke medicine, neuroimmunology and complex neurocritical care (Charité-trained; certified in neurological intensive medicine).
Chief Physician of ENT, Head & Neck Surgery and Facial Plastic Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

PD Dr. Thomas Schrom specializes in cochlear and middle-ear implants, advanced endonasal surgery, head & neck oncology, and facial plastic/reconstructive procedures. Unique expertise spanning otology, rhinology and aesthetic surgery.
Chief Physician of Urology & Uro-Oncology | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

PD Dr. Tobias Klatte is a robotic, laparoscopic and open urology expert. Focus: prostate, kidney and bladder cancer surgery, endourology and functional urology, with experience in high-volume, minimally invasive oncology.
Chief Physician of Internal Medicine, Gastroenterology & Diabetology | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

Prof. Dr. Florian Hentschel heads general internal medicine with a focus on advanced endoscopy, IBD, hepatology and integrated diabetes care. Strength: building comprehensive GI–diabetes pathways for complex multimorbidity.
Chief Physician of Neurosurgery | HELIOS Klinikum Bad Saarow

Prof. Dr. Julius Dengler covers brain & spinal tumors, cerebrovascular, peripheral nerve and functional pain surgery. Unique strengths: spine expertise and multidisciplinary tumor board leadership in a regional center.
people.doctors.helios-klinikum-berlinbuc: Chief Physician of Ophthalmology | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch

Dr. Christoph von Sonnleithner, FEBO, leads the eye clinic with full diagnostic and surgical spectrum. Focus: cataract/refractive, glaucoma, oculoplastics, lacrimal and orbital surgery; strong background from Charité.
Chief Physician of Anesthesiology & Perioperative Medicine | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Dr. David Schwaiberger directs anesthesia and perioperative care with emphasis on patient safety, modern monitoring, and surgical ICU process optimization (ex-Charité senior anesthesiologist).
Chief Physician of Oncology & Palliative Medicine | Head of the Sarcoma Center | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch

Prof. Dr. Peter Reichardt is one of Europe’s leading sarcoma experts, heading the certified Sarcoma and Oncologic Centers. Unique strengths: GIST/STS/bone sarcoma trials, guideline leadership and high-volume multidisciplinary care.
Chief Physician of Orthopedics & Trauma | Director, ENDO-Klinik Berlin | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch

Prof. Dr. Daniel Kendoff is a hip and knee arthroplasty specialist known for minimally invasive primary and complex revision endoprosthetics. Unique: tumor endoprosthetics and high case volumes with fast-track protocols.
Chief Physician of Hematology & Cell Therapy (Stem Cell Transplant) | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Prof. Dr. Bertram Glaß leads hematology, CAR-T and stem cell transplantation. Strengths: lymphoma/leukemia care, accredited transplant program leadership and >90 scientific publications.
Chief Physician of Internal Medicine & Gastroenterology | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Prof. Dr. Frank Kolligs specializes in advanced endoscopy, hepatology and GI oncology. Unique strengths: liver cancer management and comprehensive endoscopic diagnostics/therapy.
Chief Physician of Neurology | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Prof. Dr. Georg Hagemann covers the full neurology spectrum with neurovascular diagnostics (duplex, EEG/EMG, evoked potentials). Strengths: stroke, MS, epilepsy and neuro-ICU pathways.
Medical Director & Chief Physician of Cardiology and Nephrology | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch

Prof. Dr. Henning T. Baberg leads integrated heart–kidney services including chest pain unit, cath lab/electrophysiology, dialysis and cardio-MRI. Unique: system-level leadership and academic roles at MSB.
Chief Physician of ENT (Otolaryngology), Head & Neck Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch

Prof. Dr. Marc Bloching is renowned for complex head & neck reconstruction, skull base/orbital surgery, cochlear/hearing implants and gender-affirming facial procedures. Strong plastic-reconstructive portfolio.
Chief Physician of General, Visceral & Oncologic Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Prof. Dr. Roger Wahba is a liver and HPB surgery expert. Strengths: advanced oncologic resections (incl. ALPPS), multidisciplinary cancer pathways and minimally invasive visceral surgery leadership.
Chief Physician of Nuclear Medicine | HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch
Prof. Dr. Stefan Dresel specializes in PET/SPECT diagnostics and radionuclide therapies. Unique: functional imaging for oncology and personalized theranostics.
people.doctors.helios-klinikum-emil-von-: Chief Physician of Vascular & Endovascular Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Emil von Behring (Berlin-Zehlendorf)
Dr. Adam Czerwinski leads vascular and endovascular surgery with focus on aortic, carotid and peripheral interventions. Unique: program expansion in Zehlendorf and hybrid-OR endovascular expertise.
Chief Physician of Orthopedics & Trauma Surgery | HELIOS Klinikum Emil von Behring
Dr. Axel Reinhardt heads an orthopedics unit structured by subspecialty surgical sections. Focus: high-quality operative care across joint, spine and trauma with a dedicated expert team.
Chief Physician of Hematology & Oncology | HELIOS Klinikum Emil von Behring
Dr. Börge Arndt specializes in solid tumors and hematologic malignancies with precision oncology. Strengths: GI oncology, CUP, leukemias/lymphomas and modern antibody/immunotherapies.
Chief Physician of Diagnostic & Interventional Radiology, Nuclear Medicine & Molecular Imaging | HELIOS Klinikum Emil von Behring
PD Dr. Christian Althoff is an angiography and image-guided therapy expert. Unique: full-spectrum interventional radiology with oncologic, vascular and musculoskeletal procedures.
Chief Physician of Thoracic Surgery | Lungenklinik Heckeshorn, HELIOS Emil von Behring

Dr. Mohamed Zaatar is a board-certified thoracic surgeon focusing on lung cancer, metastasectomy and complex chest wall procedures. Unique: leadership of the historic Heckeshorn thoracic program (appointed 2025).
Chief Physician of Cardiology (Internal Medicine I) | Head, Helios Heart Network Berlin-Brandenburg | HELIOS Emil von Behring

Prof. Dr. Cemil Özcelik is an interventional cardiologist specializing in coronary and structural heart disease (minimally invasive valve repair). Unique: regional heart-network leadership and translational cardiogenetics background.
Chief Physician of Gastroenterology, Hepatology & Diabetology (Internal Medicine II) | HELIOS Emil von Behring
Prof. Dr. Eckart Schott is a hepatology and advanced endoscopy expert. Strengths: IBD, viral hepatitis, pancreaticobiliary disease and certified GI cancer pathways.
Neurology (information not applicable to this site)
Prof. Dr. Georg Hagemann is Chief of Neurology at HELIOS Berlin-Buch. For accuracy, list him under Berlin-Buch rather than Emil von Behring.
Cardiology & Nephrology (information not applicable to this site)
Prof. Dr. Henning T. Baberg serves at HELIOS Berlin-Buch, not Emil von Behring. Please map him to Berlin-Buch for correct SEO grouping.
Chief Physician of General, Visceral & Minimally Invasive Surgery | Certified Center for Minimally Invasive Surgery Berlin-Southwest | HELIOS Emil von Behring

Prof. Dr. Marc H. Jansen specializes in minimally invasive colorectal and hernia surgery, reflux procedures and endocrine/upper-GI operations. Unique: leadership of certified visceral oncology (colorectal & pancreatic) programs.
Visceral Surgery (information not applicable to this site)
Prof. Dr. Roger Wahba is Chief of Visceral Surgery at HELIOS Berlin-Buch since August 2023. Do not list him under Emil von Behring for SEO accuracy.
people.doctors.helios-klinikum-erfurt-dr: Chief Physician of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery | Head & Neck Tumor Center | Aesthetic Facial Surgery

PD Dr. Dr. Johannes Wikner leads Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery at Helios Erfurt, directing the Head & Neck Tumor Center and the Helios Private Clinic. Expertise: oncologic and reconstructive facial surgery, orthognathic surgery, implants and complex head–neck procedures.
Chief Physician of Spine Surgery (Orthopedics & Trauma)

Dr. Ali Ezzati heads the Spine Surgery Clinic at Helios Erfurt, performing the full spectrum from minimally invasive endoscopic procedures to complex deformity correction. High annual volumes in conservative and operative spine care underscore outcomes-focused expertise.
Chief Physician of Vascular & Endovascular Surgery | Co-Lead, Vascular Center Gotha–Erfurt

PD Dr. Hendrik Bergert specializes in aortic, carotid and peripheral revascularization using hybrid-OR endovascular and open techniques. He co-leads the cross-site Vascular Center to deliver integrated angiological–radiological–surgical care.
Chief Physician of Pneumology, Sleep & Ventilation Medicine | Head, Lung Cancer Center

Dr. Jens-Uwe Bauer directs pneumology and the certified Lung Cancer Center at Helios Erfurt. Focus: interventional bronchoscopy, sleep/ventilation medicine and multidisciplinary lung oncology pathways.
Chief Physician of Thoracic Surgery & Thoracic Endoscopy | Head, Lung Cancer Center

Prof. Thomas Seufferlein leads Internal Medicine I in Ulm with a focus on gastroenterology, hepatology and gastrointestinal oncology.

Prof. Wolfgang Rottbauer directs cardiology in Ulm, offering comprehensive interventional care, cardiovascular imaging and acute cardiac emergency services.
people.doctors.vivantes-humboldtklinikum: Chief Physician, Preventive & Nutritional Medicine | Internal Medicine & Cardiology
Dr. Frank-Peter Job heads the Vivantes Prevention Center and Nutritional Medicine programs, providing comprehensive check-ups and risk-based cardiometabolic prevention.
Prof. Veit Mansmann (orthopedics/trauma surgery) is known for joint preservation and arthroplasty; profile aligned for patients seeking modern orthopedic care in Berlin.
Chief of Gynecology & Obstetrics | Pelvic Floor & Urogynecology
Dr. Zaher Halwani leads gynecology and obstetrics at Vivantes Humboldt, specializing in urogynecology, pelvic floor disorders and comprehensive maternity care.
Senior Physician, Emergency & Internal Medicine | Acute Care Coordination
Prof. Andreas Umgelter strengthens acute and internal medicine services at Vivantes Humboldt, with publications in interventional hepatology and emergency workflows.
Professor of Neurology | Epilepsy, Stroke & Women’s Neurology
Prof. Bettina Schmitz is Chief of Neurology at Vivantes Humboldt and Berlin Epilepsy Center; key strengths include epilepsy care, stroke medicine and EEG expertise.
Professor of General & Visceral Surgery | Visceral Oncology & Complex GI Surgery
Prof. Ulrich Adam is Chief of General and Visceral Surgery at Vivantes Humboldt; he leads the Visceral Oncology Center and performs advanced GI and hepatobiliary surgery.
Chief of Gastroenterology & Hepatology | Digestive & Liver Disease
Priv.-Doz. Dr. Tobias Weismüller heads gastroenterology/hepatology at Vivantes Humboldt and Spandau, focusing on IBD, pancreatobiliary and liver disease.
Professor of Cardiology | Interventional Cardiology & Intensive Cardiac Care
Prof. Steffen Behrens is Chief of Cardiology at Vivantes Spandau and Humboldt, specializing in interventional cardiology and conservative intensive cardiac medicine.
people.doctors.vivantes-klinikum-am-urba: Chief Physician of Cardiology | Interventional Cardiology & Acute Cardiac Care
Dr. Mark Hackbarth is Chief of Cardiology at Vivantes Klinikum am Urban, Berlin. He specializes in interventional cardiology, acute coronary syndromes and modern heart failure treatment.
Professor of Psychiatry & Psychotherapy | Early Psychosis & Integrative Mental Health
Prof. Andreas Bechdolf directs Psychiatry at Vivantes Urban & Friedrichshain. He is an international expert in early psychosis, schizophrenia and integrative psychosocial care.
Professor of General & Visceral Surgery | Minimally Invasive & GI Oncology Surgery
Prof. Joachim Wagner is Chief of Surgery at Vivantes Friedrichshain and Urban. He specializes in laparoscopic and oncologic abdominal surgery, including colorectal and hepatobiliary procedures.
Professor of Thoracic Surgery | Lung Cancer & Minimally Invasive Thoracic Procedures
Prof. Christian Scholz leads Thoracic Surgery at Vivantes Urban. His expertise covers lung cancer, mediastinal tumors and modern minimally invasive techniques (VATS, robotics).
Professor of Gastroenterology | Gastrointestinal Oncology & Endoscopy
Prof. Hans Scherübl is a gastroenterologist in Berlin specializing in GI oncology, colorectal cancer prevention and advanced diagnostic endoscopy.
Professor of Cardiac Surgery | Heart Valve & Minimally Invasive Procedures
Prof. Jonas Busch is Chief of Cardiac Surgery at Vivantes Urban. He focuses on valve repair, minimally invasive cardiac surgery and heart transplantation.
people.doctors.vivantes-klinikum-neukoll: Professor of Gynecology & Obstetrics | Gynecologic Oncology & Robotic Surgery
Prof. Hüseyin Ince is a gynecologist and obstetrician at Vivantes Neukölln. He specializes in gynecologic oncology, minimally invasive and robotic-assisted surgery, and comprehensive women’s health.
people.doctors.vivantes-klinikum-spandau: Chief of Gastroenterology & Hepatology | Liver Disease & IBD
Priv.-Doz. Dr. Tobias Weismüller leads Gastroenterology at Vivantes Spandau and Humboldt. His expertise covers inflammatory bowel disease, hepatology and pancreatobiliary disorders.
Professor of Cardiology | Interventional Cardiology & Intensive Care
Prof. Steffen Behrens is Chief of Cardiology at Vivantes Spandau and Humboldt, Berlin. He specializes in interventional cardiology, acute cardiac care and intensive heart failure management.
